description: The JR286 Demand Planner II will support our Nike accessory business with overseeing the appropriate demand and inventory levels. This role works closely with Sales, Customer Service, Product, Supply Planning, and Finance teams to diagnose problems in forecast and other processes by assessing the impact to KPIs and overall inventory levels. The Demand Planner II will make appropriate adjustments to all processes and identify continuous ways to improve opportunity in Demand Planning and Buying.
responsibilities:
Support and define a 6 – 18 month rolling, wholesale demand/buy plan on assigned Nike accessory categories
Monitor buy process for assigned Nike accessory categories from demand validation to buy proposal, including managaing Safety Stock levels and adjusting for “At Once” driven business
Manage in season inventory levels to find a balance between inventory risk and stock outs
Classify the global demand risk upside, downside, excess, and obsolescence and lead-time risks and provides needed information to sales and regional teams
Monitor global order income versus demand plans and propose actions in case of deviation
Develop and drive process improvements/lead system implementations to support the demand planning and buying functions that include automation efforts
Work closely with product development and sales operations to coordinate new product launches/transitions and support VDC/DTC directives
Track and improve forecast accuracy and drive business improvement from demand planning through to the buy process
Create and manage to company inventory targets based on collaborative sales forecasting
Other duties as assigned

qualifications.required:
3 - 4 years recent experience in a large-scale retail environment, allocating footwear, apparel, accessories or fashion-based products
BA/BS in supply chain or business administration
Experience with Sales and Operations Planning Process as a team member a plus
Ability to understand organizations strategic direction and execute tactically
Analytically strong; with the ability to look at numbers and draw conclusions about actions to be taken
Computer Proficiency including spreadsheets such as Excel and Oracle 11i ASCP, MRP, inventory and purchasing modules
Certification in production and inventory management (CPIM) or Six Sigma is a plus
Capable of operating in a fast paced, dynamic and evolving environment
Must be self-directed, able to communicate effectively management group
Excellent verbal and written communication
Excels in effective time management and able to work effectively in a team environment
